Mod.MiscDesc: [B]Average ([DI][DI])[b] (1 dose) or [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI])[b] (2 doses) [B]Resilience Check[b]. Fail: 5 wound plus 1 strain per [THREAT], extra rounds per [DESPAIR]

Mod.MiscDesc: [B]Average ([DI][DI])[b] (1 dose) or [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI])[b] (2+ doses) [B]Resilience Check[b]. Fail: 5 strain. [THREAT] or [THREAT][THREAT]: no free maneuver, [THREAT][THREAT][THREAT] or more: Staggered next turn, extra rounds per [DESPAIR]

Gear.Name: Dendriton Toxin
Gear.Description: [H3]Dendriton Toxin[h3] Please see page 109 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: [B]Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Resilience Check[b]. Fail: Inflicts 1 strain, 3 strain next turn, 5 strain turn after that. Suffer [SETBACK] on all checks. Each [THREAT] inflicts 1 more strain. [DESPAIR]: Make another check on third turn or suffer 5 more strain.

Gear.Name: Dioxis Gas
Gear.Description: [H3]Dioxis Gas[h3] Please see page 109 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI])[b] (1 dose) or [B]Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI])[b] (2+ doses) [B]Resilience Check[b]. Fail: Inflicts 5 wound. Each [THREAT] inflicts 2 strain. Lasts 3 rounds.

Gear.Name: Raquor Venom
Gear.Description: [H3]Raquor Venom[h3] Please see page 109 of the Lords of Nal Hutta Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: [B]Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Resilience Check[b]. Fail: Staggers for 2 rounds. Each [THREAT] inflicts 2 strain. [DESPAIR]: Immobilizes for 2 rounds.

Gear.Name: Bearsloth Venom (dose)
Gear.Description: [H3]Bearsloth Venom[h3] Please see page 22 of the Chronicles of the Gatekeeper Adventure for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: [B]Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Resilience Check[b]. Fail: Immediate critical injury - [B]Wracking Venom - Hard ([DI][DI][DI])[b] When suffering wound or strain, suffer 2 more.

Gear.Name: Bearsloth Antivenom (dose)
Gear.Description: [H3]Bearsloth Antivenom[h3] Please see page 23 of the Chronicles of the Gatekeeper Adventure for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Gain [BO][BO][BO] to checks to resist bearsloth venom until end of encounter, or immediate remove on instance of [B]Wracking Venom[b] critical injury.

Gear.Description: [H3]Antidote Set[h3] Please see page 50 of the Desperate Allies Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Reduce check to resist poison by two (to a minimum of [B]Easy ([DI])[b]. Must make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Underworld check[b] if poison is unknown.

Mod.MiscDesc: Provides [ADVANTAGE] on Gunnery and Ranged-Heavy checks.

Gear.Name: Cyborg/Droid Interface
Gear.Description: [H3]Neuro-Saav Cyborg/Droid Interface[h3] Please see page 112 of the Strongholds of Resistance Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Allows access to hidden information in a droid's memory banks when linked.
When attempting to access information that a linked droid does not want revealed, Computer checks may be upgraded once.

Gear.Name: Cratala's Vision Cycling Implant
Gear.Description: [H3]Cratala's Vision Cycling Implant[h3] Please see page 66 of the Beyond the Rim Adventure for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: May upgrade [B]Perception checks[b] once. [AD] reveals fine details. [TR] can be spent to add a [BO] to all subsequent [B]Perception checks[b] for the encounter. [DE] adds [SE][SE] to checks, or makes some things virtually impossible to see.

Gear.Name: Cratala's Leg Enhancement Implant
Gear.Description: [H3]Cratala's Leg Enhancement Implant[h3] Please see page 66 of the Beyond the Rim Adventure for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Adds [BO][BO] to any [B]Athletics checks[b] involving the enhanced leg. [DE] means the unit shorts out temporarily, dealing 5 strain damage.

Gear.Name: Cratala's Arm Enhancement Implant
Gear.Description: [H3]Cratala's Arm Enhancement Implant[h3] Please see page 66 of the Beyond the Rim Adventure for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Adds [BO][BO] to any [B]Athletics checks[b] involving the enhanced arm. [DE] means the unit shorts out temporarily, dealing 5 strain damage.

Gear.Name: Swift 78B Vessel Courier System
Gear.Description: [H3]Swift 78B Vessel Courier System[h3] Please see page 112 of the Strongholds of Resistance Sourcebook for details.

Gear.Name: Biofeedback Regulator
Gear.Description: [H3]Biofeedback Regulator[h3] Please see page 49 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Cannot be installed on droids.
May only install a single biofeedback regulator.

Gear.Name: Escape Circuit
Gear.Description: [H3]Escape Circuit[h3] Please see page 49 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Can only be installed on droids.
Can resist restraining bolts with an [B]Easy ([DI]) Discipline check[b] May spend [AD][AD] to overload restraining bolt, rendering it useless.

Gear.Name: Networked Slicing Uplink
Gear.Description: [H3]Networked Slicing Uplink[h3] Please see page 50 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Can only be installed on droids.
Counts as having slicer gear.
When droid is slicing or assisting in slicing, add [SE] to [B]Computers checks[b] to identify slicer (e.g., the Trace User action).

Gear.Name: Neural Recorder
Gear.Description: [H3]Neural Recorder[h3] Please see page 50 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Make an [B]Easy ([DI]) Discipline check[b] to recall any information experienced while recorder was running.
Can copy recordings to common types of external storage devices.

Gear.Name: Surge Override Switch
Gear.Description: [H3]Surge Override Switch[h3] Please see page 50 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Once per encounter as an action, may make an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Discipline check[b]. If successful, may reactivate any overloaded cybernetic implants, such as from the Ion quality or similar effects, by suffering 2 strain per overloaded implant reactivated.
Cannot be overloaded by the Ion quality or similar effects.

Gear.Name: Electrobinoculars
Gear.Description: [H3]Electrobinoculars[h3] Please see page 175 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, page 190 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, or page 184 of the Force and Destiny Core Rulebook, for details.

Sources.Source: Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook

Mod.MiscDesc: User may see in low light or extreme bright light conditions.
Magnifies targetets up to 10 kilometers away.
User may remove [SE] imposed due to long range or low light.

Gear.Name: Protective Goggles
Gear.Description: [H3]Protective Goggles[h3] These goggles protect the wearer from the effects of bright light. They can negate negative consequences of light and can prevent blindness in very bright conditions. Defels wear them due to their high sensitivity to visible light. When worn by a Defel, it eliminates their light sensitivity trait.

Gear.Description: [H3]Surveillance Tagger[h3] Please see page 176 of the Edge of the Empire Core Rulebook, or page 191 of the Age of Rebellion Core Rulebook, for details.

Grants [BO] to Survival checks to navigate with map, plus an automatic [SU] for every [AD][AD] generated by Computers check

Gear.Description: [H3]Hunting Goggles[h3] Please see page 48 of the Enter the Unknown Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Grants [BOOST] to any Perception check made to locate prey
Removes up to [SETBACK][SETBACK] imposed due to concealment, darkness or fog, and mist from all Ranged-Light and Ranged-Heavy checks

Gear.Description: [H3]HSI-280 Hyperwave Signal Interceptor[h3] Please see page 101 of the Suns of Fortune Sourcebook for details.

Gear.Description: [H3]Weapon Detection Goggles[h3] Please see page 101 of the Suns of Fortune Sourcebook for details.

Gear.Description: [H3]Mark 6 Combat scanner[h3] Please see page 56 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

Gear.Description: [H3]Mark 10 Demolitions Scanner[h3] Please see page 57 of the Dangerous Covenants Sourcebook for details.

Gear.Description: [H3]Symbol of Command[h3] Please see page 44 of the Lead by Example Sourcebook for details.

Gear.Description: [H3]Mechanical Dianoga[h3] Please see page 52 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

Gear.Description: [H3]Merr-Son VX-A Intelligent Toolbox[h3] Please see page 52 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook, or page 48 of the Fully Operational Sourcebook, for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Counts as a tool kit.
Reduces time for repairs, crafting, or other Mechanics-related tasks by 50%.

Gear.Description: [H3]OR-Series Tech Recycling Station[h3] Please see page 52 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Add [BO][BO] to Perception and Mechanics checks to scavenge parts or raw materials. Checks can be completed in half the time (or a quarter of the time with the Utinni! talent).
May recover supplies worth half of the Material Price from any failed crafting check.

Gear.Name: Repulsor Clamp
Gear.Description: [H3]Repulsor Clamp[h3] Please see page 52 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Can hold a single object of 10 encumbrance or less aloft.
Removes [SE] from checks to repair hull trauma and Critical Hits on starships and vehicles.

Gear.Description: [H3]Butterbug Remote[h3] Please see page 53 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

Gear.Description: [H3]Service Patch Remote[h3] Please see page 53 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

Gear.Description: [H3]Shield Remote[h3] Please see page 53 of the Special Modifications Sourcebook for details.

Gear.Description: [H3]3-MAL Secure Comlink[h3] Please see page 52 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Transmits up to medium range on planetary scale.
Add [SE] to any check made to intercept and unscramble its signal.
Add [BO][BO] to Knowledge checks related to current events or conditions at the GM's discretion.

Gear.Name: DH77 Headcomm
Gear.Description: [H3]DH77 Headcomm[h3] Please see page 52 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Transmits up to medium range on planetary scale.
Add [SE][SE][SE] to any attempt to intercept and unscramble its signal.

Gear.Name: Atgar Artillery Remote
Gear.Description: [H3]Atgar Artillery Remote[h3] Please see page 52 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Make a [B]Hard([DI][DI][DI]) Computers check[b] ([B]Average([DI][DI])[b] if weapon is an Atgar SpaceDefense model) to link a single Gunnery weapon. If success, weapon gains Inaccurate 2 and holder can fire the linked weapon via remote from up to medium range.

Gear.Name: Low-Feedback Scanner
Gear.Description: [H3]Low-Feedback Scanner[h3] Please see page 53 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Can detect radiation of silhouette 1 within short range, life forms within medium range, power sources within long range, and comms signals within extreme range. Increase range band by 1 for every silhouette size higher than 1.

Gear.Name: SE-Vigilant Automated Sensor
Gear.Description: [H3]SE-Vigilant Automated Sensor[h3] Please see page 53 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

Gear.Name: Nullcaine
Gear.Description: [H3]Nullcaine[h3] Please see page 53 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: May apply to self or engaged character by making an [B]Easy ([DI]) Medicine check[b] and choosing one [B]Easy ([DI])[b], [B]Average ([DI][DI])[b], or [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI])[b] Critical Injury on the target. If successful, target suffers 3 strain and ingores effect of Critical Injury until the end of the encounter.

Gear.Name: Stimstick
Gear.Description: [H3]Stimstick[h3] Please see page 53 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Removes [SE] from Discipline, Perception, Resilience, or Vigilance checks to stay awake or notice something due to fatigue or lack of sleep until end of encounter. At end of encounter, target suffers 1 strain.

Gear.Name: Military Trauma Pack
Gear.Description: [H3]Military Trauma Pack[h3] Please see page 53 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Can only be used to use Medicine skill to attempt to remove Critical Injuries from others without penalty, but no other treatment options, as specified on page 232 of the [B]Age of Rebellion[b] Core Rulebook.

Gear.Name: Condenser Unit
Gear.Description: [H3]Condenser Unit[h3] Please see page 54 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Can gather enough water each day to sustain one person. Batteries last six months.

Gear.Name: Portable Power Generator
Gear.Description: [H3]Portable Power Generator[h3] Please see page 54 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: May recharge a depleted piece of equipment as a maneuver, or a droid or larger piece of machinery in an hour.
Engaged character may ignore "out of ammo" [DE] results in the same manner as an Extra Reload.

Gear.Name: Pretormin Plastent
Gear.Description: [H3]Pretormin Plastent[h3] Please see page 54 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Removes [SE][SE] to checks to resist hostile temperatures while sleeping in tent, and downgrades difficulty of such checks once.

Gear.Name: Military Modular Backpack Frame
Gear.Description: [H3]Military Modular Backpack Frame[h3] Please see page 55 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details. [BR][I]Note: To purchase modules for the modular backpack frame, select the frame in your inventory and click the "Attachments" button. An "attachment" will be available for adding a variety of modules to the backpack. Up to two modules may be added.[i]

Gear.Name: Imperial Officer's Cap
Gear.Description: [H3]Imperial Officer's Cap[h3] Please see page 96 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Adds [BO] to Coercion checks targeting Imperial troops.

Gear.Name: Stormtrooper Helmet/ComLink
Gear.Description: [H3]Stormtrooper Helmet/ComLink[h3] Please see page 96 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

Gear.Name: Imperial Intelligence Badge
Gear.Description: [H3]Imperial Intelligence Badge[h3] Please see page 96 of the Forged in Battle Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Adds [BO][BO] to Fear checks caused by Imperial operatives to himself and all allies within short range.

Gear.Description: [H3]Karrak Spice[h3] Please see page 48 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: For non-Force users, removes [SE][SE][SE] added to checks from pain or illness for 12 hours and imposes [TH] to all checks for 24 hours. Force users receive both effects for twice the duration, but suffer -1 to Force Rating while active.

Gear.Name: Karrak Spice (100 doses)
Gear.Description: [H3]Karrak Spice[h3] Please see page 48 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: For non-Force users, removes [SE][SE][SE] added to checks from pain or illness for 12 hours and imposes [TH] to all checks for 24 hours. Force users receive both effects for twice the duration, but suffer -1 to Force Rating while active.

Gear.Description: [H3]Questioner-9 Interrogation Serum[h3] Please see page 48 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Five minute delay. Victim upgrades the difficulty of all checks to withold information or resist manipulation (including Force powers) once for next 24 hours.

Gear.Name: Questioner-9 (1 dose)
Gear.Description: [H3]Questioner-9 Interrogation Serum[h3] Please see page 48 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Five minute delay. Victim upgrades the difficulty of all checks to withold information or resist manipulation (including Force powers) once for next 24 hours.

Gear.Name: Yaladai Spice (1 dose)
Gear.Description: [H3]Yaladai Spice[h3] Please see page 48 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: For one encounter, whenever user suffers involuntary strain, suffer 3 less strain (minimum 1). Force user adds [FO] to power checks, but doubles strain and Conflict for using [DA].

Gear.Name: Yaladai Spice (100 doses)
Gear.Description: [H3]Yaladai Spice[h3] Please see page 48 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: For one encounter, whenever user suffers involuntary strain, suffer 3 less strain (minimum 1). Force user adds [FO] to power checks, but doubles strain and Conflict for using [DA].

Gear.Name: Infrabinoculars
Gear.Description: [H3]Infrabinoculars[h3] Please see page 48 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Can see through up to two meters of wall. Dense or shielded materials impose at least [SE] to Perception checks (GM's discretion).

Gear.Name: Infrabinoculars (Long Range)
Gear.Description: [H3]Infrabinoculars (Long Range)[h3] Please see page 48 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Can see through up to two meters of wall. Dense or shielded materials impose at least [SE] to Perception checks (GM's discretion).
User may see in low light or extreme bright light conditions.
Magnifies targetets up to 10 kilometers away.
User may remove [SE] imposed due to long range or low light.

Gear.Name: Microdroid Listener
Gear.Description: [H3]Microdroid Listener[h3] Please see page 48 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Planting this device unnoticed requires an [B]opposed Skulduggery vs. Vigilance check[b]. Once planted, requires a [B]Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Vigilance check[b] to locate.

Gear.Name: Privacy-7 Audio Curtain
Gear.Description: [H3]TaggeCo Privacy-7 Audio Curtain[h3] Please see page 49 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Listening to a conversation protected by curtain requires a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Perception check[b] to understand anything said. [TH] or [DE] may be spent to misunderstand key words or phrases.

Gear.Name: Model 31 Palm Stunner
Gear.Description: [H3]Merr-Sonn Model 31 Palm Stunner[h3] Please see page 49 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Use on unaware target with [B]opposed Skulduggery vs. Stealth check[b]. Success incapacitates a minion or deals 12 strain to rival or nemesis. Each [SU] adds 1 damage.

Gear.Name: Scramble Key
Gear.Description: [H3]Scramble Key[h3] Please see page 49 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Bypasses simple locks within 5 minutes. May attempt [B]Daunting ([DI][DI][DI][DI]) Skulduggery check[b] to speed up process. Each [SU] reduces time by one minute. Failure triggers alerm. Force users may add power check, adding [SU] or [AD] for each [FP] generated.

Gear.Name: Disaster Relief Kit
Gear.Description: [H3]Disaster Relief Kit[h3] Please see page 50 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: May sustain a character for a week to ten days with rationing.

Gear.Name: Foot Speeder
Gear.Description: [H3]Foot Speeder[h3] Please see page 50 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.[P][I]Note: This item is also included as a vehicle.[i]

Gear.Name: Repulsor Assist Unit
Gear.Description: [H3]Repulsor Assist Unit[h3] Please see page 51 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Reduces difficulty to climb by 2, to minimum of 0.
May attach to cargo to reduce encumbrance by 7.

Gear.Name: Urban Compass
Gear.Description: [H3]Urban Compass[h3] Please see page 51 of the Endless Vigil Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: In urban environments, remove [SE][SE] from checks due to unfamiliarity, traffic, or other travel hazards.
Grants [BO] to checks to find information about an urban environment, including city operations, landmarks, and businesses.

Gear.Name: Bioscan
Gear.Description: [H3]Bioscan[h3] Please see page 53 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: When scanning for life signs, grants [BO] to [B]Perception vs. Stealth checks[b].
Verifying identity requires an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Computers check[b] and a biometric identifier.

Gear.Name: Holonet Homing Beacon
Gear.Description: [H3]Holonet Homing Beacon[h3] Please see page 53 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.

Gear.Name: Tracker's Goggles
Gear.Description: [H3]Tracker's Goggles[h3] Please see page 54 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Grants [BO] to Perception checks to locate a target by sight.
Removes [SE][SE] imposed due to concealment, darkness, or fog/mist from Ranged (Light) and Ranged (Heavy) combat checks.

Gear.Name: Com-Scan
Gear.Description: [H3]Com-Scan[h3] Please see page 54 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Can trianguate location and movement of a known comlink or transeiver within close range (planetary) with an [B]Average ([DI][DI]) Computers check.[b]

Gear.Description: [H3]Holographic Disguise Matrix[h3] Please see page 54 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Add [BO][BO] to Deception checks to impersonate target.
Add [SE][SE] to onlookers' Perception checks to detect imposter.

Gear.Description: [H3]Saline Pump[h3] Please see page 55 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Add [BO] to Clawdite's checks to pass himself off as another person.
Add [SE] to others' checks to detect the Clawdite's deception.

Gear.Name: Sleeppack (one dose)
Gear.Description: [H3]Sleeppack (one dose)[h3] Please see page 55 of the No Disintegrations Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Applying to an aware target requires a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Brawl[b] or[B]Melee check[b].
Victim must make a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Resilience check[b] or take 10 strain damage.

Gear.Name: Repulsor Trap
Gear.Description: [H3]Repulsor Trap[h3] Please see page 60 of the Friends Like These Adventure Module for details.

Gear.Description: [H3]Explosive Implant[h3] Please see page 60 of the Friends Like These Adventure Module for details.

A [B]Daunting ([CH][DI][DI][DI]) Medicine[b] or [B]Mechanics check[b] is required to remove implant. [TH] alerts transmitter of tampering, and [DE] triggers device.

Gear.Name: Stun Collar
Gear.Description: [H3]Stun Collar[h3] Please see page 60 of the Friends Like These Adventure Module for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: When remotely activated to subdue, inflicts 10 stun damage.
When remotely activated to be lethal, inflicts 12 damage and a Critical Injury at +20.
Removing collar without shocking its wearer requires a [B]Hard ([DI][DI][DI]) Mechanics check[b].

Gear.Description: [H3]Czerka BC-7 Environmental Cocoon[h3] Please see page 46 of the Disciples of Harmony Sourcebook for details.

Gear.Description: [H3]Kamperdine Clothing Specialists Body Glove[h3] Please see page 47 of the Disciples of Harmony Sourcebook for details.

Gear.Description: [H3]Applied Imaging B310 Micro-Imager[h3] Please see page 47 of the Disciples of Harmony Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Adds [BO][BO] to Perception, Knowledge (Lore), or Knowledge (Education) checks requiring magnification of fine details.

Gear.Description: [H3]Dalabar SDS-632 Surveillance Detector[h3] Please see page 48 of the Disciples of Harmony Sourcebook for details.

Gear.Description: [H3]Fabritech 7000 Geoscanner[h3] Please see page 48 of the Disciples of Harmony Sourcebook for details.

Gear.Description: [H3]Antishock Blanket[h3] Please see page 49 of the Disciples of Harmony Sourcebook for details.

Gear.Description: [H3]Bioscan (Medical)[h3] Please see page 50 of the Disciples of Harmony Sourcebook for details.

Gear.Description: [H3]Plasma Protein Replicator[h3] Please see page 50 of the Disciples of Harmony Sourcebook for details.

Gear.Description: [H3]Spray Plasto-Cast[h3] Please see page 50 of the Disciples of Harmony Sourcebook for details.

Gear.Description: [H3]Foamcast[h3] Please see page 44 of the Fully Operational Sourcebook for details.

Mod.MiscDesc: Foamcast adds [BO] to checks to repair structures and vehicle hulls.
GM may spend [TH] on checks to repair structures and vehicle hulls to have the foamcast can be depleted.
A can of foamcast can be made into an improvised explosive.
[DE] on the Mechanics check means the can ruptures and covers user in foamcast.
